revised_title: A Remarkable Fossil Discovery by Edward Wright
tldr: Edward Wright discovers a large Orthoceratites fossil in a marble table in Ghent, which he believes is very rare in England. The fossil measures two feet four inches and 7-10ths in length and has sixty-six distinct partitions. The fossil is immersed in a coarse-grained, dusky brown marble and is filled with the stalactical matter of the marble.
